newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian share market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Belgian share market closing report.

text.p: The Brussels bourse got off to a bad start of the new year, closing 1.29 percent lower in a session marred by technical problems.
The Bel-20 index closed down 24.44 points at 1,871.05. Nineteen of the index components closed lower, only oil group Petrofina ended unchanged at 10,100 francs.
The start of trade was delayed by almost three hours as the bourse's computerised trading system was unable to cope with the New Year date change.
Dealers said that trade was thin as many investors are still on holidays. Trade is seen returning to normal on Monday.
"It's difficult to work because the market is empty," said trader Paul de Lophem at Mignon, Hanart, Declerck.
